destinations.description: Only Coordinates Coordinates for an area in deep space.
Hostile Forest/Jungle/Desert Landing site is planet-side wilderness, far from human habitation, or on an uninhabited world.
Mine A mining facility, far from a colony or starport.
Spaceport Spaceport on an asteroid or moon, or a landing field near a larger settlement.
Asteroid/Moon The surface of an asteroid or a small moon. Vacuum or dangerous atmosphere.
Space Station An orbiting space station.
Earth The busy hub of all interstellar traffic and commerce.
Young Colony A small colony with only a few hundred inhabitants.
Established Colony A busy colony with several thousand people and a thriving, local industry.
Starship A starship in orbit, awaiting your arrival.
Outpost A small outpost, usually planetside. An outpost is commonly just a single complex with a specific function; corporate, military or scientific.

goods.name: Industrial gases
goods.description: Propylene, acetylene, propane, ethyl-formate, chlorofluorocarbon, ammonia, carbon monoxide, ethylene oxide, hydrogen chloride, sulfur dioxide, sulfur hexafluoride.

goods.name: Metal ingots or pellets
goods.description: Gold, platinum, palladium, silver, tungsten, copper, iron, etc.

goods.name: Colonists
goods.description: Humans in stasis, ready to begin a colonization project

goods.name: Timber
goods.description: Exotic alien tree products destined for Earth

goods.name: Ice/Water
goods.description: Water, water ice or some other rare frozen solution

goods.name: Industrial chemicals
goods.description: Aluminium Chloride, Aluminium Sulfate, Calcium Acetate, Monosodium Phosphate, Ferric Sulphate, Sodium Hydroxide, Hydrochloric Acid, Sodium Aluminate, Polyaluminium Chloride, Ferrous Chloride, Borate, Potassium Acetate etc.

goods.name: Fertilizer
goods.description: Multi-nutrient fertilizer compounds made up of nitrogen, potassium and/or phosphate

goods.name: Oil
goods.description: Crude oil, or liquid petroleum by-products

goods.name: Foodstuff
goods.description: Bulk foods such as chickpeas, soybeans and other legumes, grains (corn, barley, rice, wheat) or refined versions thereof

goods.name: Ore
goods.description: Bauxite (aluminum), galena (lead), pentlandite (nickel), gold-quartz, cassiterite (tin), malachite (copper), magnetite (iron), platinum-bearing sand, trimonite (tungsten)

goods.name: Medicinal goods
goods.description: Vaccines, medicines, disinfectants, surgical gear, scanning machines, hospital beds

goods.name: Technical parts
goods.description: Different makes and types, for suits, refineries, vehicles, power stations, hospitals, prospecting gear, factories, atmospheric processors, weaponry or life support systems

goods.name: Starship technical parts
goods.description: Modules, features, parts for/from dismantled ships

goods.name: Pressure suits
goods.description: Space suits for delivery to the colonies

goods.name: Single oversized item
goods.description: Wind turbines, power station generator, space station hull frame, solar panel assembly, drilling machinery, ore processing mill or furnace

goods.name: Vehicles
goods.description: Diggers, tractors, quad-tracks, all-terrain vehicles, power loaders

goods.name: Weapons & armor
goods.description: Firearms, ammunition and armor for the colonies or remote stations

goods.name: Radioactives
goods.description: Processed uranium cakes or uranium dioxide powder, or fusion plant fuel pellets such as deuterium, tritium, protium or helium-3

goods.name: Colony construction
goods.description: Beams, modules, airlocks, outer shells, roofing material, etc.

goods.name: Animal feed
goods.description: Feed concentrates containing grains, high-protein oil meals and byproducts of sugar beet and sugarcane processing

goods.name: Livestock/animals
goods.description: Cattle in stasis, ready for rearing on an off-world colony

goods.name: Wreckage/Salvage
goods.description: Shuttle, or escape/cargo pod requiring investigation and study

complications.name: Embargo/Quarantine
complications.description: The destination is placed under quarantine or an embargo.

complications.name: Intermission
complications.description: The ship’s computer brings the ship out of hyperspace early, and then wakes the crew. What’s the story?

complications.name: Military
complications.description: A military starship sends over a small search party for a “routine” ICC and customs check. Should the PCs be worried?

complications.name: Delay
complications.description: There is a delay in lift-off/undocking; perhaps fuel for the reaction drives or coolant cannot be pumped aboard. There may be a strike, an administrative hold-up or loading equipment may have broken down.

complications.name: Maintenance
complications.description: A critical part (drive pump, plasma coil, coolant pump, water recycler, gravity compensator control unit, sensor gimbal motor, etc.) requires replacement before it fails, requiring most of the crew’s participation.

complications.name: Waiting game
complications.description: Problems at the destination mean they aren’t ready to accept the cargo. Can the crew help speed things along?

complications.name: Cargo mishap
complications.description: There is a serious problem with the cargo, either moving, leaking, over-heating or catching fire.

complications.name: Wreckage
complications.description: A small piece of wreckage is spotted on the sensor scope; a cargo container, escape pod, frozen corpse, part of a starship—smashed or blown off, etc.
